title: Penetration Testing Consultant
description:
**Nu söker vi** 
 fler Penetrationstestare till HiQ!
   

  

 Vi på HiQ fortsätter att bygga upp vårt Cybersecurity-team och söker nu en driven och erfaren penetrationstestare som vill vara med och skapa en säkrare digital framtid. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med några av de mest utmanande och spännande säkerhetsuppdragen inom branschen – från penetrationstester och säkerhetsgranskningar till att vara med och utveckla vår infrastruktur, verktyg och metodik för framtidens säkerhetslösningar.
   

  

**Som en del av vårt team kommer du att:**
* Utföra olika former av penetrationstester och IT-säkerhetsgranskningar för våra kunder.
* Samarbeta med andra experter inom områden som nätverksarkitektur, Active Directory, informationssäkerhet (GRC), Cloud och utveckling för att skapa de bästa lösningarna.
* Delta i verifiering och utvärdering av nätverk, genomlysning av hybridlösningar och granskning av komplexa webbapplikationer och hårdvara.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet inom penetrationstester, red teaming eller relaterade områden.
* Har en utbildning inom informationssäkerhet, eller har förvärvat din kompetens genom erfarenhet och självlärd utveckling.
* Behärskar svenska flytande i både tal och skrift.
* Har en bakgrund som kan inkludera nätverksteknik, systemadministration eller programmering.


**Varför HiQ?**
* Du får chansen att arbeta i ett team där vi har roligt och stöttar varandra, samtidigt som vi bygger norra Europas ledande tech-konsultbolag.
* Hos oss får du stor frihet att bidra med egna idéer och utveckla nya verktyg som kan implementeras i olika kunduppdrag.
* Vi värdesätter kreativt samarbete, där vi tillsammans bygger en stark grupp som trivs och utvecklas ihop.
* Våra kunder finns inom många branscher, såsom statliga myndigheter, Medtech, bank/finans, fordon och retail – din spelplan är alltså stor och varierande.


**Krav:**
* Svenska medborgarskap krävs för att kunna genomföra säkerhetsprövningar hos vissa utav våra kunder.
* Tjänsten är hybrid med utgångspunkt i Stockholm.


 Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär som penetrationstestare och vill vara med på en spännande resa med HiQ? Tveka inte att söka! Vi ser fram emot att höra mer om dig och hur du kan bidra till vår gemensamma utveckling.

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Har du arbetat något/några år i en servicedesk, som onsite-tekniker eller IT-tekniker ? Vi på Nexer Infrastructure i Stockholm söker nu fler konsulter som är sugna på att fördjupa sina kunskaper samt utvecklas inom IT. Hos oss får chansen att arbeta hos välkända bolag i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor – senast var vi på en Åreresa tillsammans!


**Om tjänsten**
 Som konsult inom IT-support arbetar du brett inom IT och användarstöd, och mer specifikt mot ramverk och verktyg så som Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365, grundläggande nätverksteknologier och ärendehanteringssystem såsom ServiceNow med flera. De flesta uppdragen innebär att du hjälper någon av våra kunder med IT-support på klientsidan och supporterar internt anställda genom telefon, mail, chatt och ärendehanteringssystem. I vissa uppdrag kan även onsite-support förekomma samt hårdvarusupport för datorer, kringutrustning, skrivare och AV utrustning.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du**
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk/first line support
* Motiveras av att lösa problem och lämna användaren med ett leende på läpparna
* Trivs i att bemöta människor och ge stöttning på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi ser gärna att du är bekant med följande tekniker: Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365/Azure, Windows Remote Desktop, SCCM/Intune, arbete i ärendehanteringssystem samt grundläggande kunskap om nätverksfelsökning. Det är också ett plus om du har supporterat Mac klienter tidigare.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du har god analytisk förmåga, tar initiativ och är ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp, eftersom du som konsult kan komma att arbeta i olika sammanhang.
   

  

**Mer o** 
**m Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och att framtidssäkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunchträffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökan** 
  

  

 Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: SAP Integration Specialist (Successfactors)
description:
Job Title: SAP Integration Specialist - SuccessFactors
 



 Location: Stockholm, Hybrid
 



 Candidates should be based in Sweden.
 



  





 Job Description:
 



 We are seeking a highly skilled SAP Integration Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in integrating SAP systems with SuccessFactors. This role involves working closely with various departments to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance of our HR systems.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



 Design, develop, and implement integration solutions between SAP and SuccessFactors.
 



 Collaborate with HR, IT, and other departments to gather requirements and ensure successful integration.
 



 Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues in a timely manner.
 



 Monitor and maintain integration processes to ensure data accuracy and system reliability.
 



 Provide technical support and training to end-users.
 



  





 Qualifications:
 



 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
 



 Proven experience in SAP integration, specifically with SuccessFactors.
 



 Strong understanding of SAP modules and SuccessFactors functionalities.
 



 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 



 Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 



 Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 



  





 Preferred Skills:
 



 Experience with SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) or other middleware tools.
 



 Knowledge of HR processes and best practices.
 



 Certification in SAP SuccessFactors or related modules.

title: Enterprise - Inside Sales Rep - Nordics
description:
**About Us**
**Always open. Our code, our culture, our opportunities. Leading open innovation without limits. We are SUSE.**
 SUSE is a global leader in innovative, reliable and secure enterprise open source solutions, including SUSE Linux Enterprise (SLE), Rancher and NeuVector. More than 60% of the Fortune 500 rely on SUSE to power their mission-critical workloads, enabling them to innovate everywhere – from the data center to the cloud, to the edge and beyond. SUSE puts the “open” back in open source, collaborating with partners and communities to give customers the agility to tackle innovation challenges today and the freedom to evolve their strategy and solutions tomorrow.
   

  

 We are open in our roots and open in our approach, striving to be the most trusted open innovator in the World. Openness extends beyond our technology. Our vibrant community thrives on diversity and connectivity without borders.
   

  

 Enterprise - Inside Sales Rep - Nordics
   

  

**Job Description**
 Focus Areas
   

  

* Work closely with Enterprise Account Executives (AEs) to prospect for new contacts and opportunities within existing Strategic accounts
* Map accounts and engage with key stakeholders
* Manage inbound leads from Account Based Marketing (ABM)
* Work together with partners in the Nordics to unlock new demand in existing accounts
* Follow up leads from marketing events


**Preferred Experience & Skills**
* Fluent English, Swedish and/or Finnish
* Brings a solid understanding of the Open Source, Software Defined Infrastructure or Cloud market and related customer needs.
* Demonstrable experience in account mapping and securing meetings with new stakeholders in Enterprise accounts
* Clear playbook on building accounts insights and creating messaging and outreach sequences to raise SUSE’s profile
* Understands the different customer buying stages and common pain points, creating tailored messages which resonate with senior buyers
* Understands the value of partners in strategic account selling
* Solid use of qualification methodologies (such as MEDDPICC).
* Experience with using Linkedin Sales Navigator
* Experience with working with CRM and lead sequencing tools such as Salesforce, Hubspot, Outreach and Groove.
* Clear understanding of the Nordics tech market and trends


 Personal Attributes
   

  

* The ideal candidate will embrace the transformative nature of this role - as we continue our evolution, we require you to build capability and institutionalise best practices within the sales region.
* Questioning and challenging assumptions will be necessary.
* Your relationship building skills both with direct peers but also across the wider business will be critical, as will your ability to drive for results.
* Dealing with ambiguity and being both resourceful and enterprising should be second nature to you.
* Hungry for success, driven for results
* Self-motivated and self-starter
* Confident, creative, curious, adaptable


**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**What We Offer**
**We empower you to be bold, driving your career to create the future you want. We celebrate and reward your achievements.** 
  

  

 SUSE is a dynamic environment that is evolving rapidly, thus requiring agility, strong entrepreneurship and an open mind.
   

  

 This is a compelling opportunity for the right person to join us as we continue to scale and prosper.
   

  

 If you’re a big thinker, obsessed by execution and thrive in a dynamic environment in which you can tangibly create a lasting legacy, then please apply now!
   

  

 We give you the freedom to be yourself. You will work in a global community of unique individuals – like you – with different backgrounds, talents, skills and perspectives. A truly open community where everyone is welcome, has a voice and is encouraged to reach their full potential regardless of age, gender, race, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion, or any other characteristics.
   

  

**Sounds like the right fit for you?** 
 Click
 **A** 
**pply** 
 to submit your resume. A recruiter will contact you if your skills match our current or any future positions. In the meantime, stay updated on the latest SUSE news and job vacancies by joining our
 **Talent Community** 
**.**
**SUSE Values**
* We are passionate about customers
* We are respectful and inclusive
* We are empowered and accountable
* We are trustworthy and act with integrity
* We are collaborative
* We are SUSE!

title: Backend Developer - Java
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
 You will be part of a diverse DevOps team that works in two-week sprints and in ten-week program increments.
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You have experience in DevOps and preferably in Telecom.
* At least 5 years of experience in backend Java programming, preferably using technologies like Spring Boot, JMS, RelDb (or similar tools) and AWS (Serverless, nodeJ)
* Solid experience in using Unix, Linux
* Experience from Test-driven development (TDD)
* Experience of Agile way of working


**Good:**
* Understanding of scalability and experience of load tests
* Understanding of Micro services architecture and design


**Merits:**
* Experience in UDP, Binary SMS and sat-com
* Experience n ASN1
* Experience in Automotive industry and connectivity.


**Meritorious**
* CI/CD, CDK, Code Pipelines, Docker, Serverless development, load testing


**Application deadline:** 
 22-12-2024
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Funktionell lösningsarkitekt till våra leveransprojekt inom D365 F&SCM
Konsultchef till SAP Stockholm
description:
*Är du en engagerad och uppskattad ledare med passion för kundutveckling? Har du en proaktiv inställning och förmåga att skapa framgångsrika relationer? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig! Implemas SAP-team fortsätter att växa, och vi söker nu en konsultchef som samtidigt vill jobba operativt som projektledare och service manager till vårt kontor i Stockholm.*
**Om rollen**
 Inom SAP-teamet framtidssäkrar vi våra kunders affärer med hjälp av SAP:s affärsplattformar S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, Customer Experience (CX) och Business Technology Platform. Som konsultchef och projektledare/service manager på Implema får du en dynamisk och mångsidig roll där du kombinerar projektledning, kundutveckling och personalansvar.
   

  

***Konsultchef***
 Implemas viktigaste tillgång är vår personal, och som konsultchef är ditt främsta uppdrag att utifrån individuella behov säkerställa att personalen trivs och utvecklas på företaget. Det gör du genom att vara en coachande och närvarande chef som skapar förutsättningar för kontinuerlig vidareutveckling och säkerställer att dina konsulter har det stöd de behöver för att leverera högkvalitativt arbete hos våra kunder. Du arbetar aktivt med att bidra till och bibehålla den familjära, omhändertagande stämning som Implema är känt för. Som konsultchef blir du en del av vårt SAP ledningsteam.
   

  

***Projektledare/service manager***
 Som projektledare/service manager arbetar du med allt ifrån att projektleda och driva SAP projekt från förstudiefas till driftsättning, till att stödja existerande kunder på deras digitaliseringresa. Detta innefattar att leda och fördela arbetat inom kundteamen, planera och realisera uppgraderingar/releaser samt effektivisera kundens affärsprocesser utifrån deras behov och förutsättningar. Du har helhetsansvar för dina projekt och hanterar kundmöten, avtal, budget, planering, genomförande och uppföljning. En viktig del i rollen är också att stötta våra kunder med förändringsledning, som syftar till att kunden till fullo kan tillgodogöra sig värdet av gjorda investeringar.
   

  

******Är du vår nya kollega?******
 För att trivas i rollen har du erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla starka affärsrelationer i en kundnära miljö. Du är uppskattad för dina starka kommunikationsegenskaper och förstår vikten av tydlighet i kommunikationen, externt såväl som internt. Med en gedigen erfarenhet av projektledning, gärna ERP-projekt, är du van vid att arbeta enligt etablerade projektmetodiker.
   

  

 Vi tror du antingen haft personalansvar tidigare eller ser detta som ett naturligt nästa steg i din karriär, då du trivs i ledarrollen. Att hålla dig uppdaterad inom ditt expertområde är en självklarhet, och du har en god känsla för vad som fungerar i praktiken. Med ett konstruktivt förhållningssätt lyfter du gärna problem och utmaningar med fokus på att hitta hållbara lösningar.
   

  

**Implema erbjuder dig**
 Välkommen in i en dynamisk organisation med en kultur och ett engagemang som kännetecknas av en stolthet och stark vilja att alltid driva arbetet framåt. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss!
   

  

 Arbetsglädje, kreativitet och personlig utveckling börjar med god hälsa och att du mår bra. Därför eftersträvar vi att tillsammans med dig säkerställa en hållbar work-life balance i din tillvaro. För oss är det minst lika viktigt som att erbjuda alla våra anställda jobb i en god, hållbar arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässiga löner och förmåner.
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 400 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Electronics Engineer
description:
Boule Diagnostics AB is a global diagnostics company that develops, manufactures and markets instruments and consumable products for blood diagnostics. The company serves hospitals, clinics, laboratories and companies within blood diagnostics, in both human and veterinary hematology. The company operates via subsidiaries in Sweden, the USA, Mexico and Russia. The company products are sold globally primarily through distributors, supported by Boule’s own local sales and support personnel. The Boule shares are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2011.
We are strengthening our product care team and are now looking for an Experienced Electronics Engineer!



As an Electronics Engineer, in our team, you will work with the product & process care of existing instruments. You will also ensure that the designs are driven by meeting the current and future needs of our customers and requirements from regulatory authorities.


**Job description**


* Leading of electronic design activities for existing products and product care activities within the team
* Collaborate and contribute to our multi-functional product care team by investigating, testing, and verifying new components in our instruments to ensure their functionality and performance meet the highest standards
* Perform complaint investigations related to certain components
* Develop and upgrade production test equipment
* Perform and support technical investigations, tests and verifications of various types related to our instruments
* Continuously improve testing methodologies and processes to enhance our efficiency and effectiveness


**Competence requirement**


* Master´s degree in Electronics Engineering
* Solid experience of PCB layout and schematics design


**Meritorious**


* Experience from working with sophisticated products consisting of software, mechanics, and electrical interfaces, preferably with in-vitro diagnostics instruments and/or other types of medical devices.
* Preferably product development experience of similar product types.


**Note:** Interviews are conducted on a rolling basis, and the position may be filled before the deadline. Apply early!  

  

If you have any questions related to the role or the life at Boule, kindly contact the manager Jaakko Niva at jaakko.niva@boule.com or HR at HR@boule.se.

title: Regional Service Engineer - GM Europe
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

The General Motors Europe Regional Service Engineer (RSE) provides on-site professional automotive engineering, business and customer support to GM’s retail and wholesale networks. The RSE will have broad responsibilities including vehicle diagnostic and repair support, product problem resolution and region management support for GM.


The RSE will perform on-site service, diagnostics, repairs, and installation of GM accessories on customer vehicles as directed by GM Management. The RSE will support GM to reduce vehicle repurchases and warranty expense. RSE will also evaluate GM Service Centre processes, provide Service Centre onsite service readiness feedback and support GM IT applications at GM Service Centre’s.


**Service Centre & Authorized Repairer Support**

* Provide 1ST and 2nd level, on-site support to resolve automotive technical and GM IT service operation issue. Respond promptly to customer vehicle concerns that may lead to “vehicle off road” or potential “repurchase” situations.
* Maintain an effective working relationship with the GM Europe Technical Assistance to support vehicle repairs.
* Work closely with the GM Europe Customer Call Center (CCC), Quality team and Dealers Network to respond to customers that have contacted CCC for assistance with their vehicle.
* Use GM’s analytic tools and supporting data to address vehicles in the assigned area and assist Service Centre’s quickly to resolve all vehicle technical issues.
* Demonstrates proactivity by identifying and addressing process gaps or implementing innovative solutions when needed.
* Takes ownership of personal development by independently managing a learning journey, utilizing available online resources and platforms effectively. Disposition and intention to work in dynamic environments.
* Review Service Centre’s process on every Service Centre’s contact.
* Implement service strategies to enhance Service Centre’s effectiveness.
* Support GM scheduled and ad-hoc in- Service Centre’s training sessions.
* Report on Service Centre’s “State of Health” relative to overall service readiness.
* Understand customer complaints, collect vehicle data, and drive “root cause analysis”.

**Wholesale Support**

Develop and maintain positive relationships with GM National and Regional Management responsible for Service Operations and Vehicle/Powertrain Brand Quality, with a focus on product quality improvements and warranty issues. Represent GM in the assigned region for automotive technical issues as required:


* Monitor Warranty performance, review all escalated warranty claims and identify warranty waste opportunities.
* Attend to requests from GM wholesale personnel including Regional Service management, Vehicle/Powertrain Brand Quality, and Engineering and provide feedback in agreed formats.
* Provide support for arbitration hearings, legal cases and repurchases.
* Provide Brand Quality support for vehicles at Port of Entry and Regional Compounds.
* Actively participate to create Technical Trainings and on-site practical sessions
* Provide support for Technical Quality related activities, PDI process or Investigations.
* Support Field Actions or recall activities, in the port of Transport, Retailers, Dealers or any other as specified.
* Support Marketing events, Launches or new Platform events where Vehicles are displayed

**Required Qualifications and Experience**

* 5 years + extensive hands-on Automotive Manufacturer / Importer/Dealership Service Department
* Nationally recognized ICE/EV Automotive Technician Certifications as required by local regulations.
* Possession of a valid EU/Country driver’s license and a clean driving record
* Proficiency using MS Office, Outlook, OBD tools, digital platforms and online ERP software
* Ability to: Manage, resolve, document, and close dispatched cases in the required timeframe. Build and maintain customer relationships with Service Centre’s management teams. Work with minimal direction and be responsible for self-training to maintain and increase skills.
* Excellent communication and time management skills to optimally prioritize and deliver critical services and communicate, if necessary, directly with customers
* Self-motivated with a proactive approach to meeting and exceeding customer expectations.
* Proficiency in local language(s), min. Swedish and English
* Proficient user of Data Bus Diagnostic Tools (e.g., via TIS/GDS, NeoVi /V-Spy Intrepid Tools etc.)
* Business travel required 3-4 days per week

***Remote:*** *This position does not require employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee’s role enables them to work off-site on a permanent basis. The position will include Cross- Border responsibilities.*

**About GM**
------------

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


**Why Join Us**
---------------

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


**Diversity Information**
-------------------------

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.


We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
company_description: We see a future with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions, Zero Congestion.

title: HW R&D Engineer to ABB Electrification
description:
**HW R&D Engineer to ABB Electrification**
==========================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


Are you passionate about creating high-quality, scalable, and easily configurable electronic solutions? Do you thrive in a global and diverse environment, applying your expertise to develop the foundations for next-generation products? If so, we invite you to join ABB’s Electrification business area as a R&D Engineer for Electronics Hardware Development. Be part of a highly motivated, agile team where your innovative ideas will shape the future of ABB’s cutting-edge products. Responsibilities: Design and Development: Create, implement, and optimize analog and digital circuits from concept to serial production. Technical Specifications: Develop schematics, define PCB layout constraints, and establish verification specifications. Testing and Verification: Conduct simulations, prototype testing, and documentation to ensure designs meet the highest standards. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product owners, system architects, and software developers to translate market requirements into hardware specifications. Innovation and Strategy: Monitor industry developments, propose R&D projects, and identify technical drivers to align with ABB’s business goals. Knowledge Sharing: Expand your expertise through internal and external networks. Risk Management: Take responsibility for hardware development activities, ensuring alignment with project targets while coordinating with suppliers and other functions. Intellectual Property: Contribute to securing ABB’s IP through patent development.


### **Qualifications for the role**

* M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Electronic Engineering, Embedded Systems, or a related field.
* Minimum of 2 years as a hardware design engineer in embedded systems.
* Expertise in designing electronic circuits and working with simulation tools.
* Fluency in English (written and spoken) is essential; Swedish skills are an advantage
* Willingness to travel internationally (<5%).

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Stephan Wildermuth. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Senad Huijc, +46 730 88 30 06; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Johan Lundström, +46 730 77 03 66. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ludvig Ahlqvist. We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or latest 5th of January 2025. Please visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Design Engineer – Child Bike Seats and Strollers
description:
**- Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Make a Real Impact on the Safety and Comfort of Children! -**

*Do you have a passion for creating products that make a real difference in families lives? Are you excited about developing innovative, safe, and functional solutions for families who love outdoor adventures? If you're driven by the challenge of designing products that combine cutting-edge technology with the highest standards of safety and comfort for children, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!*


At **Thule**, we’re on a mission to help families explore the world with ease, knowing their children are secure and comfortable. We’re expanding our team to develop next-generation child bike seats and strollers that set the standard for safety, design, and usability. If you want to work in a company that values creativity and craftsmanship and where your work will have a lasting impact on families, this role is for you.


As a **Design Engineer for Child Bike Seats and Strollers**, you’ll have the unique opportunity to take part in designing solutions that help children explore the world from the back of a bike or in a stroller, knowing that every detail—from materials to ergonomics—has been carefully thought through to ensure their safety and comfort.

**Why Thule?**  

At Thule, we’re not just about building products; we’re about building trust. Parents trust us to deliver products that are as safe as they are functional, and that’s a responsibility we take seriously. We’ve invested heavily in state-of-the-art resources, including a modern prototype workshop, allowing you to bring your ideas to life quickly and efficiently. You’ll work alongside passionate, like-minded engineers and designers, all driven by the same goal: to make family life safer, easier, and more fun.

**What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Designing and developing **child bike seats** and **strollers** that meet Thule’s uncompromising standards for safety, comfort, and usability.
* Driving the product development cycle from ideation to industrialization, ensuring products meet Thule’s high-quality and safety standards, while being on time and within budget.
* Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams (designers, engineers, and project managers) to create solutions that exceed the expectations of families everywhere.
* Selecting the best materials and manufacturing techniques, always with a focus on durability, comfort, and sustainability.
* Conducting hands-on testing and prototyping to refine and perfect your designs, ensuring they deliver the best possible experience for both parents and children.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience) with a focus on design engineering or product development.
* Experience with SolidWorks or similar CAD software and an understanding of materials like plastics, metals, and textiles commonly used in child safety products.
* A passion for designing products that solve real-world problems for families, especially in the field of children’s safety.
* A collaborative mindset, eager to work in a multidisciplinary team and share ideas that push the boundaries of innovation.
* A strong commitment to quality and safety, with a keen eye for detail in design and testing.
* Fluency in English—it’s the main language we use for communication.

**About You:**

* You are passionate about creating safe, comfortable, and innovative products that will improve the lives of children and families.
* You are excited by the idea of being involved in the entire lifecycle of a product, from concept to market, with a focus on quality, usability, and design.
* You enjoy problem-solving and thrive in an environment where creative solutions are encouraged.
* You are motivated by the chance to leave a lasting impact on the products you design, knowing they will be part of families' everyday lives and adventures.
* You are proactive, self-driven, and eager to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.

**About our Global Product Development Department**  

Globally we are over 250 engineers out of the majority is working in our Global Product Development Center in Hillerstorp (Sweden). Our cross functional team consists of highly skilled and motivated members with a well-balanced variety of experiences. We are a truly global company with an international and multi-cultural team. English is the language we use in our daily communication. We see a great future with continued passion for product development that is so vital for our growth as a company. We set great value in our working environment and offer great premises designed for product development. In our Global R&D center in Hillerstorp we have expanded with new offices, landscapes, team rooms and creative areas, but also great prototype areas including cut & sew and electronics lab.  

  

**Application**  

The role reports to our Manager Design Engineering Strollers & CBS, Simon Stråth (simon.strath@thule.com).  

Simon is available to answer detailed questions regarding the position by email.  

For more information about the recruitment process or the position, please contact the recruiter Fredrik Stigbäck at Fredrik.stigback@thule.com or +46732 360560.  

Please apply through our website at www.thulegroup.com/open-positions with your CV and cover letter.  

Do not wait until the last application date—interviews are held continuously during the process, and the position may be filled before the final deadline of January 12th, 2025.

  

About Thule Group Thule Group is a global sports and outdoor company. We offer high-quality products with smart features and a sustainable design that make it easy for people across the globe to live an active life. Under the motto Active Life, Simplified — and with a focus on consumer-driven innovation and long-term sustainability — we develop, manufacture and market products within the product categories Sport&Cargo Carriers (roof racks, roof boxes and carriers for transporting cycling, water and winter sports equipment, and rooftop tents mounted on a car), Juvenile & Pet Products (car seats, strollers, bike trailers,child bike seats and dog transport), RV Products (awnings, bike carriers and tents for RVs and caravans) and Packs, Bags & Luggage (hiking backpacks, luggage, laptop- and camera bags). title: Design Engineer - Original Equipment
description:
* **Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Shape the Future of Automotive Product Development!**

*Are you an innovative engineer eager to contribute to cutting-edge products that enhance active lifestyles? Do you have a strong interest in the automotive industry and want to work with world-leading car manufacturers to design and develop high-quality products? If you’re looking for a role that challenges your engineering skills and pushes the boundaries of automotive accessories, we want to hear from you!*


At Thule, we are constantly pushing the limits of product development. We are a world leader in providing smart, secure, and stylish solutions for people who live life to the fullest. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a talented **Design Engineer** to join our Original Equipment Supplier (OES) department.

**About the Role:**  

As a Design Engineer in the OES department, you will be part of a dynamic team working closely with global automotive manufacturers to develop tailored solutions for various car models. You will work on an exciting range of products including roof racks, roof boxes, bike carriers, water and winter sport solutions, and more—designed to meet specific customer requirements.


You will be responsible for developing state-of-the-art products alongside cross-functional project teams, including Project Managers, Simulation Engineers, Test Engineers, Prototype Technicians, and fellow Design Engineers. You will manage the complete product development cycle—from concept to industrialization—while ensuring that each product meets our high standards for quality, performance, cost, and design.


You will leverage your mechanical engineering knowledge and utilize tools such as CAD, simulation software, and moldflow analysis to create both functional and aesthetically appealing products. As a key player in the product development process, you will also handle prototype orders, evaluate test results, and incorporate any necessary design changes based on testing and analysis.

**What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Design and develop high-quality products and components for automotive OEMs, ensuring they meet specific requirements for functionality, cost, and timeline.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to lead the development from concept to production, while managing key product attributes like mechanical performance, manufacturability, and design compliance.
* Use CAD tools (SolidWorks preferred) and other technical tools for product design, simulation, and analysis.
* Collaborate with prototyping teams to test, validate, and refine product designs.
* Analyze test results and make design adjustments to improve strength, durability, and overall performance.
* Ensure that all designs are feasible for high-volume production, focusing on manufacturability and cost efficiency.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* A degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent, with some years of relevant work experience in design engineering.
* Ideally, you have experience in the automotive industry or in consumer products for high-volume production.
* Experience in 3D CAD (SolidWorks preferred) and experience with PLM systems and technical documentation.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and adapt designs based on feedback from testing and simulations.
* A hands-on, proactive, and entrepreneurial mindset, with a passion for creating products that meet customer needs and exceed expectations.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment.
* Fluency in English—it’s the main language we use for communication.

**About You:**

* You have a genuine passion for product development and a keen interest in the automotive sector.
* You thrive in a team-oriented environment and enjoy collaborating with diverse groups to solve complex engineering challenges.
* You’re self-motivated, enthusiastic, and excited to make a real impact through your work.

**About our Global Product Development Department**  

Globally we are over 250 engineers out of the majority is working in our Global Product Development Center in Hillerstorp (Sweden). Our cross functional team consists of highly skilled and motivated members with a well-balanced variety of experiences. We are a truly global company with an international and multi-cultural team. English is the language we use in our daily communication. We see a great future with continued passion for product development that is so vital for our growth as a company. We set great value in our working environment and offer great premises designed for product development. In our Global R&D center in Hillerstorp we have expanded with new offices, landscapes, team rooms and creative areas, but also great prototype areas including cut & sew and electronics lab..

title: Validation Test Lead
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi letar nu efter en Validation Test Lead för spännande uppdrag.



Den perfekta kandidaten har väldigt bred kompetens och har tidigare jobbat med både elektronik, mekanik samt mjukvaruutveckling. Du har goda kunskaper inom hållfasthetslära och har förmågan att resonera dig fram till varför defekt "Y" kan komma från problem "X".


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Du har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom maskinteknik eller elektroteknik.
* 5+ års erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att leda.
* Erfarenhet inom programmering.
* Erfarenhet av mekanisk design.
* Flytande i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska


Grundläggande kunskap om kugg, drivlinor, elektronik samt kraftelektronik.


### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Som person är du social och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du är självgående, drivande och noggrann i ditt arbete. Som konsult på Sigma är det också viktigt att ha god förståelse för kundens önskemål samt teknikens möjligheter.



### **WE OFFER**



Vårt erbjuder en möjlighet att få vara med och bygga upp ett företag i framkant.


* En flexibel arbetsdag
* Högt individuellt förtroende
* En framåtblickande organisation
* Vi drivs av nya idéer och utveckling
* Bra förmåner
* Årliga aktiviteter och konferenser


*Sigma Industry Evolution AB är ett teknikkonsultföretag inom produkt- och produktionsutveckling med fokus på Mekatronik, Elektronik och Embedded Systems.*


*Kombinationen av lång branscherfarenhet, stort engagemang, interna och externa uppdrag samt ett tätt samarbete mellan Sigmas olika verksamheter i regionen skapar ett unikt branschöverskridande växthus för ingenjörer. Med mångfald, delaktighet och entreprenörskap stärker och utvecklar vi vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare.*

title: Senior Design Engineer
description:
### **Who We Are**


At Volvo Cars, bold visions are becoming reality. We are shaping the future of the automotive industry by building a digital ecosystem that makes our customers' lives simpler and aims for Zero Collisions. To achieve this, we are seeking innovative and curious individuals who want to make a difference and drive positive change through creative thinking.

  


### **What You'll Do**


As a System Design Engineer, you will play a key role in developing the next generation of premium Volvo cars. Your mission will be to ensure that all sensors, from LiDARs and ultrasonic sensors to cameras and radars, operate seamlessly to meet our vehicles' functional needs. You will work at the heart of our development process, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, architects, and software developers to create robust and innovative technical solutions.


In this role, you will provide leadership by creating clarity and providing direction for teams. You'll define and optimize tools and processes to enhance development within the organization, ensuring that requirements are well-balanced and aligned with our goals. Together with multidisciplinary teams, you will tackle a variety of challenges, including designing systems for core compute, breaking down functional requirements, ensuring compliance with safety and cyber security standards, and navigating legal demands.


This broad scope offers you a unique opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of vehicle systems while honing your expertise in designing concepts, writing requirements, planning, and coordinating efforts across teams.

  


### **Who You Are**


You bring a strong background in system design paired with a passion for quality, clarity, and collaboration. You thrive in creating structure, simplifying complexity, and working in an agile, inclusive way. Your ability to connect with stakeholders and balance expectations makes you an inspiring and effective communicator.


You hold either a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in electronics, mechatronics, software, or a related field, and you have more than six years of experience in system design. You possess hands-on expertise in functional safety, such as ISO 26262 or SOTIF standards, as well as knowledge of cyber security. Your experience includes working with tools and protocols like Ethernet, TCP/IP, and CAN.


You are fluent in English and excel in communication, enabling you to collaborate effectively across teams and disciplines. While not mandatory, holding a valid EU B-level driver’s license would be considered an asset.


At Volvo Cars, we celebrate different perspectives and create opportunities for everyone to thrive. Join us to make a real impact on the future of mobility and safety while growing your skills in an inspiring and supportive environment. Together, we’ll drive change for a safer and more sustainable future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Field Service Engineer - Iceland
description:
**Bring more to life.**

  

Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology? At Cytiva, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.

  

You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life. Working at Cytiva means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.

  

At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. Take your next step to an altogether life-changing career.

  

The **Field Service Engineer** is responsible for servicing and qualifying our customer’s biopharma equipment such as liquid chromatography, filter integrity and cell culturing equipment (for example ÄKTA, FlowStar, Xcellerex). You will be working in laboratories and pharmaceutical production plants on customer sites, and will be responsible for performance of customer visits, including customer coordination, travel planning and ordering spare parts. You will be expected to take part in our 24/7 stand-by team.

**This position reports to the Zone Manager and is part of the Nordic field service team with 20 engineers across Sweden, Finland, Lithuania, and Denmark. This is a field role where you will support local customers in Reykjavik, Iceland, but also travel to customers in the rest of Nordics and Baltics. On a part time basis, you will work as part of our online support engineer team. You will be home office based.**

 **What you will do:**

* Plan & perform preventive maintenance, repair and installation visits
* Plan & perform qualifications (IQ/OQ)
* Promptly complete and return relevant paperwork (and electronic evidence) associated

**Who you are:**

* Background in Biotechnology, Chemical, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering, Automation, Electronics, or any related technical/scientific experience. This can come from a Bachelor's degree, Associate’s degree, military experience, or an equivalent technical education or professional experience.
* Fluent in English
* Good communication and social skills, and effective organizational and administrative skills
* Valid driving license and EU work permit with ability to travel extensively within Nordics and Baltics

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Fluent in Icelandic or any other Nordic languages
* Experience of chromatography or cell culturing products
* Experience in troubleshooting mechanics, electronics, software/computers/networks or fluid handling systems
* Experience of working in laboratory or clean room environment

**Application:**


We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application. If you have questions, feel free to contact Zone Manager Maria Ekblom on maria.ekblom@cytiva.com or +46 706123045. We look forward to seeing your application.


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Principal Civil Engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Principal Civil Engineer interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. They will be tasked with solving complex Civil Engineering-related problems and work independently with minimal guidance. The Principal Civil Engineer may lead functional teams or projects and is considered a specialist. As such, they must have in-depth expertise in Civil Engineering and broad knowledge of the Civil discipline within the Engineering function.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Perform conceptual, FEED, and detailed analyses and design as per design basis, project specifications, design codes, and standards
* Apply in-depth skills and broad knowledge of the business to address complex problems and nonstandard situations
* Prepare clear and accurate detailed design calculations and analyses, including design reports and - procedures
* Manage own time to meet objectives and (as Lead Engineer) forecast and plan resource requirements
* Communicate and explain difficult concepts and persuade others to adopt a point of view
* When acting as Lead Engineer, in addition:
	+ Direct medium or large Engineering team as a Lead Engineer
	+ Lead the Discipline engineering design of the assigned work area and complete it within the planned schedule and budget, by standards, MDR, and project-specific procedures and to a high professional standard
	+ Plan, organize, and direct all aspects of Discipline execution on the assigned project, including scope, deliverables, schedule, and all workforce resources - agree on allocations with the Discipline Manager
	+ Ensure interfaces and deliverables are identified
	+ Maintain responsibility for progress and productivity, identifying any required corrective action
	+ Act as project representative for the Discipline during meetings with Project Team,
	+ Customer discipline lead and relevant agencies such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc.
* Train/mentor other employees in the department
* Assist and monitor MOPEX offices on projects
* Initiate interface with other disciplines to obtain input for discipline designs
* Help to maintain Unifi
* Prepare bids from sketching data, using experience
* Supervise engineers and designers
* Define scopes of work for engineering/construction fabrication yard
* Provide engineering support as required
* Perform engineering checks of drafting
* Perform engineering checks prepared by others within the discipline
* Perform design verification through single discipline check and assist with inter-discipline checks (IDC)
* Prepare MTOs of foundations and structures
* Prepare specifications
* Prepare subcontracts
* Review of vendor data
* Prepare technical bid evaluations
* Assist in furthering the department
* Tasks as Engineering Specialist:
	+ Coordinate and check the work of senior and junior engineers
	+ Conduct peer reviews on request
	+ Provide technical assistance where required
	+ Prepare structural analyses and report on calculations or perform specialist tasks (i.e., architectural designs, underground piping designs, complex foundations/structures, weight control reports, the center of gravity reports)
	+ Specialized in several fields (geotechnical, steel, concrete, dynamic calculations, FEM, fatigue calculations, earthquake, blast, hydrodynamics, architectural)
	+ Specialized in several design codes (EC, ACI/AISC/API, GOST)
	+ Check designs for operational requirements, constructability, and maintainability
	+ Prepare project engineering guides
* Tasks as Lead Engineer:
	+ Work as Lead Engineer on medium to large-size EPC projects
	+ Full responsibility for all engineering and design work on any project
	+ Full control and manages work hours, materials, progress
	+ Work in close liaison with the Design Coordinator
	+ Set up all engineering computer systems
	+ Assist the Project Manager in:
		- Prepare deliverable control
		- Prepare schedule
		- Prepare progress reports
		- Prepare man-hour and capital expenditure estimates
* Coordinate with project management
* Train personnel under their supervision
* Responsible for discipline within the engineering group
* Manage (design) subcontracts
* Identify and manage changes in the scope of work
* Responsible for filing engineering work
* Give relevant feedback to the department

Reports to:
   

Project: Lead Engineer, Project Engineering Manager or Project Manager
   

Functional: Supervising Department Manager
   

Liaise With: All Engineering disciplines, Construction site/Fabrication Group, Safety Dept, Project Management Team,
   

Document Control, Project Planner, Project Cost Controller, QC and Certification Group, Procurement Group, Subcontractors
   

and Vendors, and Customers
   

Supervises: Senior Engineers, Engineers and Designers


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Engineering
* 15-20 years in oil and gas with a major contractor or consultant, predominantly performing detail design
* Detailed knowledge of design techniques and analysis methods and detailed knowledge of the theory, content, and application of standards, codes, and guidelines as applicable
* Knowledgeable in project coordination and execution skills
* Preferably Registered Professional Engineer or member of professional engineering society as applicable
* Seasoned structural knowledge
* Very good organizer, motivator, and supervisor
* Able to solve problems without assistance
* Keen on improving the effectiveness of the work
* HSE, TQM, and cost-conscious
* Fluent in English, both oral and written
* Understanding and supporting company goals and work processes
* Show flexibility and ensure proper hand-over with regards to:
	+ The reassignment to other departments/construction sites/fabrication yards
	+ The replacement of colleagues during illness and holidays
	+ The provision of assistance to other colleagues with heavy workloads (also other projects) when possible/desirable
	+ The managing/learning of current working methods and software applications
* Reassignment to other McDermott offices
* Good understanding of the other engineering departments
* Good understanding of construction/fabrication yard and client requirements
* Commercial insight

#LI-PF1

title: IR Systems Engineer
description:
Be visionary
Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.  

Job Description  

Your contribution
We are looking for candidates with a Master or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or Engineering Physics, and 2-5 years of work experience. You should be skilled in MATLAB and/or Python, preferably with experience in signal and/or image processing and have a genuine interest in technology and problem-solving.
 It is important for us that you like to collaborate in a team and can solve problems through discussion and knowledge sharing. At the same time, you should be able to independently work on and solve complex technical challenges that directly impact the manufacturing, performance, and experience of our thermal cameras. Additionally, it is important that you have an interest in both theoretical and practical work.
Your job in plain text* *Develop and implement calibration concepts in production for* *temperature-measuring* *thermal cameras.*
* *Design, simulate, and analyze thermal camera systems at the component, subsystem, and system levels.*
* *Develop new capabilities to test and evaluate the performance of new and launched systems.*
* *Develop and refine tools, models, simulations, algorithms, and software for testing and evaluating infrared sensors and systems.*


To be ready to take on this role we would love if you have* *Fluent in both Swedish and English*
* *Experience with Electro Optical Systems*
* *Knowledge about infrared sensors*
* *Experience in multi-disciplinary* *engineering R&D* *and product development*
* *Interest in practical work i.e. building prototypes*


What Teledyne FLIR offers you* Opportunity to develop your career with the world's leading company in thermal and sensing technology
* At FLIR, you get a unique opportunity to experience how cutting-edge R&D, software- and hardware development come together under one roof. We do our research, our development, and our manufacturing
* Friendly culture with a focus on collaboration, problem-solving, and creativity.
* Work closely with R & D and Production
* A fair compensation structure and benefits such as wellness rewards


Interested?
If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
The selection process is ongoing, so don't wait, but no later than the *2024-12-31.*
We may select our final candidate before the advert expires.
When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
We accept applications in English and Swedish.
(Non-US) This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.  

Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
.

title: Mekatronikingenjör
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Vill du vara en del av framtiden?**


Vill du arbeta i teknikens framkant och bidra till att forma morgondagens lösningar? Hos Sigma Industry i Växjö får du möjligheten att vara en del av innovativa projekt inom t.ex. medicinteknik, försvarsindustrin, tillverkningsindustrin och fordonsbranschen. Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och göra skillnad!



Till vårt team i Växjö söker vi nu efter mekatronikingenjörer för spännande uppdrag hos våra kunder.



Den perfekta kandidaten har väldigt bred kompetens och har tidigare jobbat med både elektronik, mekanik samt mjukvaruutveckling.



**Vad erbjuder vi?**



* Möjligheter att arbeta med världsledande kunder och projekt i teknikens framkant.
* En personligt anpassad karriärväg där du får utvecklas genom utbildningar och mentorskap.
* Tillgång till kreativa samarbeten inom olika teknikområden.
* En arbetsmiljö som värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid.


Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss och ta nästa steg i din karriär!



**Är Sigma Industry din nästa karriärsdestination?**



Hos oss blir du välkomnad av glada och hjälpsamma kollegor. Vi har en arbetsplats med högt i tak, där vi har roligt och arbetar i ett klimat som uppmuntrar engagemang. Du står aldrig ensam inför en utmaning – här kan du alltid bolla idéer och hitta lösningar tillsammans med dina kollegor. Vi tror starkt på att samarbete är nyckeln till framgång.



På Sigma Industry får du möjlighet att samarbeta med experter från olika teknikområden och dela idéer i en stödjande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Vi investerar i våra medarbetare och erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och utbildning, vilket ger dig chansen att växa och bredda din expertis.



Sigma Industry är ett entreprenörsdrivet företag med stora visioner och snabba beslutsvägar. Det ger dig möjlighet att påverka både din egen utveckling och företagets framtid. Oavsett om du vill fördjupa dig inom ditt befintliga expertisområde, utforska nya områden eller engagera dig i interna initiativ, så finns alla möjligheter här. Hos oss får du det bästa av båda världar: en trygg anställning, en stimulerande arbetsdag och en skräddarsydd karriärväg.



Vi tror på att du ska trivas på jobbet. Här skapar vi en positiv och inspirerande arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och arbetsglädje står i fokus. Välkommen till Sigma Industry i Växjö – en plats där du inte bara formar din egen framtid, utan också bidrar till vår teknologiska utveckling. Kom och gör skillnad tillsammans med oss!



**Vill du bli vår nya kollega?**



Känner du igen dig i beskrivningen? Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Vi hanterar urval och intervjuer löpande.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Du har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom Data, Maskinteknik eller Elektroteknik.
* 5+ års erfarenhet
* Kan läsa kretsschema.
* Erfarenhet inom programmering.
* Erfarenhet av mekanisk design.
* Flytande i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Som person är du social och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du är självgående, drivande och noggrann i ditt arbete. Som konsult på Sigma är det också viktigt att ha god förståelse för kundens önskemål samt teknikens möjligheter.



### **WE OFFER**



Som konsult hos oss får du arbeta tillsammans med de främsta utvecklingsintensiva företagen inom svensk industri. Uppdragen anpassas alltid i möjligaste mån, för att nivån ska bli så utvecklande och stimulerande som möjligt. Omkring dig kommer du ha många duktiga kollegor och ett aktivt erfarenhetsutbyte. Vår företagskultur präglas av entreprenörskap och korta beslutsvägar. Gemenskap, engagemang och glädje är viktiga element som vi anser skapar trivsel.



*Sigma Industry är ett dynamiskt teknikkonsultföretag inom produkt- och produktionsutveckling som utmanar de etablerade standarderna.*



*Kombinationen av lång branscherfarenhet, stort engagemang, interna och externa uppdrag samt ett tätt samarbete mellan Sigmas olika verksamheter i regionen skapar ett unikt branschöverskridande växthus för ingenjörer. Med mångfald, delaktighet och entreprenörskap stärker och utvecklar vi vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare. Skulle du vilja utvecklas i denna miljö?*



### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Martin Bodén,  

+46 761153232  

Martin.Boden@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Mekatronikingenjör
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry South
* #### **LOCATION**


Växjö, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Calculation & Simulation, Mechanical Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Software development embedded systems, System design, System development, Test & Quality, Software development
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-12-06
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-01-31
* #### **CONTACT**


Martin Bodén, Martin.Boden@sigma.se, +46761153232
