title: Solution Knowledge Specialist - Body worn solution
description:
Job Title
Solution Knowledge Specialist - Body worn solution
Job Description*Axis is a fast growing and innovative IT company with a global footprint. Our success is largely due to our highly skilled staff and our strong culture of daring to succeed and allowing ourselves to constantly break new ground. We allow and promote independent thinking; we seek to act as one, to be always open, and to think big!* *We are now looking for a Solution Knowledge Specialist to join our Body worn solution team within the New Solutions Initiative department.*
Who is your future team?  

We are the product management team for Axis body-worn solution. We are a close-knit team of six who work together in the same space. Everyone agrees that this setup is highly positive and energizing.  

We each have our areas of responsibility but share information freely, support one another, and frequently brainstorm ideas together. There’s an open atmosphere where everyone feels comfortable voicing their opinions, and everyone listens and takes feedback constructively. Every day is filled with lively discussions. Our team is full of energy and engagement. We have clear goals that we are all aligned with and work toward together.  

  

New Solutions Initiative is globally responsible for Axis body worn offerings. Our scope includes e.g. portfolio planning, product planning, managing the products' life cycle, education & training and handling of complex support issues. Our interfaces are both internal such as R&D, Operations, Sales and Marketing as well as external customers, partners and suppliers.  

New Solutions Initiatives goal is to contribute to a smarter and safer world by providing market leading body worn solutions. Our body worn solutions consist of hardware, software as well as services. See more info here: https://www.axis.com/solutions/body-worn-solutions
What you’ll do here as a Solution Knowledge Specialist?  

As Solution Knowledge Specialist in the New Solutions Initiatives team, your main task is to transfer knowledge about our body worn solutions to our regional sales and marketing organizations and feedback findings and user needs to product management and R&D. Your area of expertise is to develop knowledge about body worn solutions available in the market. You will support product management, R&D, sales and marketing with insightful information about other solutions and how our body worn solution offering differs, unique selling points and other relevant information to make our market approach successful.
You will practically test and evaluate body worn solutions as well as gather and analyze information coming from our sales regions. Based on this you will develop different types of educational material, e.g. trainings, videos, how-to-do, and documentation of how Axis offering compares to other solutions available in the market etc. You will deliver the material through a multitude of channels, including prerecorded online webinars and training sessions in front of live audiences. You will also be responsible for maintaining all the knowledge about available solutions including our own solutions, so that it can be used by others at Axis.  

You will work in a team of product managers, solution specialists and a global sales engineer that works closely with R&D. Further you will cooperate with corporate marketing, market intelligence, global sales and product introduction management. Together with them you have the responsibility to deliver the knowledge that Axis sales organization needs to be successful with our body worn solutions.  

We travel to strengthen relations but focus on digital media to become efficient. Travelling up to 20 days a year.  

Who are you?  

As Solution Knowledge Specialist in New Solutions Initiatives you will work in an engaged team. We are looking for a driven and structured individual with a curious mindset and a passion for testing new technology and sharing knowledge. We believe you have a service minded attitude and that you are practical when it comes to technical matters, as you will need to do hands-on product testing and product evaluation.  

You have social skills and an ability to manage and perform in a multi-cultural environment with international contacts. You enjoy a high-pace and to have multiple activities ongoing in parallel. You are always open to customers and colleagues, contributing to a good team spirit and a productive environment. You are Furthermore we believe you have:* At least 5 years work experience
* Documented experience from creating and presenting educational materials
* A pedagogic approach, both spoken and written, when explaining technical matters
* Excellent presentation skills
* Self-going and curious
* An engineering background
* Fluent in English. Swedish language skills are not a requirement, but a distinct advantage

  

Bonus points if you have:* Experience from network video surveillance solutions
* Experience from the law enforcement market or the security market

  

What Axis have to offer  

This is a great possibility to take part in supporting and developing a new exiting area for Axis, together with a focused team with the support of a larger organization. If you’re looking for a challenge and want to be part of a great entrepreneurial spirit, this is a chance of a lifetime. In addition, we can offer a truly global environment working with the latest technology in complex systems and applications.  

We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning “fika” every day, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.  

  

Curious to discover more?  

We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.  

  

Check out:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
READY TO ACT?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success.  

Find out more about the position from our recruiting manager Erik Frännlid at 046- 272 1800. We’re looking forward to seeing you!
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-01-03*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Field Service Engineer (Nordics)
description:
Work with cutting edge technology, making the world a safer and more secure place. DroneShield (ASX:DRO) offers an opportunity to solve some of world’s most challenging technical problems in the Electronic Warfare, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, RF sensing, Sensor Fusion and distributed systems. Working with high profile customers across militaries, government agencies, airports, critical infrastructure, law enforcement and many others.  

With one of the largest listed defence company market capitalisations in Australia and having raised approximately $250m in 2024 alone, DroneShield is undergoing hypergrowth stage, fuelled by rapidly increasing use of drones for nefarious applications, from battlefield, to terrorism, to contraband delivery and commercial espionage.  

DroneShield is headquartered in Sydney, Australia with approximately 200 staff based in the 4,000sqm facility today, scheduled to grow to approximately 300 staff by end of 2026. Overseas on the ground presence includes Virginia (USA), Denmark, Germany and Dubai, as well as distributors in over 70 countries globally.  

This role will be based anywhere in the Nordics, but preferable within driving distance to Aalborg. **About the role**
The Delivery Team is expanding in response to increased customer traction around the globe. DroneShield is looking to recruit a Field Service Engineer who will work with the team to ensure DroneShield customers receive the best possible support, from RFI all the way through to after sales product support.  

The position will report primarily to the Associate Project Manager and will work closely with the Business Development Team, Operations Team and the Product Development Team. This role will suit someone with excellent attention to detail and a passion for technology who wants to develop their career in a fast-moving ASX listed defence technology company.**Responsibilities, Duties and Expectations*** Collaborate with the sales team providing support in customer technical engagement, reviewing system architectures and quotations for technical accuracy
* Serve as a primary customer interface for accounts from ordering through to installation, maintenance, and ongoing support
* Plan and manage installations of complex systems of multiple products
* Engage with customers to receive and document technical feedback
* Support new product development projects by serving as the “voice of the customer” to the engineering team
* Perform “end-user” validation testing of new products and software releases
* Provide remote and on-the-ground technical support to customers
* Conduct engineering investigation and analysis to resolve technical issues with limited support
* Develop and maintain documentation of DroneShield systems and processes to ensure continual improvements over time
* Establish and maintain close relationships with internal and external stakeholders and customers. Develop strong, reliable channels of communication with end customers from a range of technical and cultural backgrounds
* Keep yourself up to date with the latest technologies, tools and methods to be effective in your role.

**Qualifications, Experience and Skills*** Engineering or other relevant technical education/background is required
* Experience in a Field Service Engineering role, providing technical support directly to customers and managing projects with engineering teams
* Experience in networking devices (essential)
* Proficient with Linux operating system (essential)
* Experience in testing of complex systems
* Experience with electronic warfare and/or radars or similar systems is required
* Coding experience is highly regarded (Python, Go and/or JavaScript ideal)
* Knowledge from a range of engineering fields and history collaborating with stakeholders and subject matter experts from a variety of backgrounds
* Existing Defence Security Clearance is preferred but not essential
* No criminal record and ability to obtain Defence Security Clearance is mandatory

 *Note for recruitment agencies: we do not accept floated candidates from external recruiters unless they were instructed to do so.*

title: Control System Engineer - Mechanical Drive
description:
**Control System Engineer**

 **A Snapshot of Your Day**


Join an open and dynamic workplace where professional and personal development is a priority! The group is responsible for designing the control system for our customers gas turbines, primarily for the mechanical drive. We are involved from the start of the order until customer handover.


We offer a variety of tasks, flexible working hours and excellent development opportunities, weather you are in the beginning of your professional career or already an experienced engineer. You will receive an individual education package tailored to your background and experience, along with a dedicated mentor from the department to support you in the initial stages of your journey at Siemens Energy!

 **How You’ll Make an Impact**

* Adapt control programs for both the gas turbine and compressor to meet specific project requirements, ensuring flawless operation.
* Improve, develop and program technical solutions to optimally integrate the compressor with the gas turbine
* Procure the necessary hardware and software
* Configure network settings to ensure optimal communication between the turbine and the compressor.
* Participate in customer meetings to discuss specifications, progress, and address any concerns.
* Conduct simulation and testing and provide technical support during workshop testing and commissioning.
* Collaborate with other engineering fields and teams, such as electrical and mechanical engineers and project managers.

 **What You Bring**

* A keen interest in control systems, technology, and computers and experience working with control systems, preferably Siemens PCS7 or T3000.
* An educational background, high school or university level, with a focus on electrical/data/mechatronics or similar.
* Practical work experience in commissioning of gas turbines or with compressors and their integration with control systems and gas turbines is highly advantageous.
* Ability to handle international contacts in a professional manner. You speak and write Swedish and English fluently, with additional language skills being advantageous.
* In your work, you are structured and thorough and follow the processes defined for the role. You are a problem solver that find it easy to collaborate with colleagues and customers. You are driven, have the willingness to develop and are relatively self-reliant.

 **About the Team**


The team you will be part of consists of 15 people from all around the world and different backgrounds. There is always someone to discuss solutions and ideas with, and we strive to support each other and build strong technical knowledge within the team.

  

Our Gas Services division offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

  

We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

  

Who is Siemens Energy?


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

  

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

  

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

  

Our Commitment to Diversity


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

  

Application


Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs , id nr 267606 not later than 2024-12-23

  

Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.

For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Mikael Nimvall on Mikael.nimvall@siemens-energy.com

 **A Snapshot of Your Day**


Be part of an open and dynamic workplace where professional and personal development is high on the agenda. The group is responsible for designing the control system for our customers gas turbines.

title: Design Engineer – Child Bike Seats and StrollersSETS - Hill English 2023
description:
* Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Make a Real Impact on the Safety and Comfort of Children! -


Do you have a passion for creating products that make a real difference in families lives? Are you excited about developing innovative, safe, and functional solutions for families who love outdoor adventures? If you're driven by the challenge of designing products that combine cutting-edge technology with the highest standards of safety and comfort for children, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!
  
  

At Thule, we’re on a mission to help families explore the world with ease, knowing their children are secure and comfortable.
  
  

We’re expanding our team to develop next-generation child bike seats and strollers that set the standard for safety, design, and usability. If you want to work in a company that values creativity and craftsmanship and where your work will have a lasting impact on families, this role is for you.
  
  

As a Design Engineer for Child Bike Seats and Strollers, you’ll have the unique opportunity to take part in designing solutions that help children explore the world from the back of a bike or in a stroller, knowing that every detail—from materials to ergonomics—has been carefully thought through to ensure their safety and comfort.
  
  

Why Thule?
  
At Thule, we’re not just about building products; we’re about building trust. Parents trust us to deliver products that are as safe as they are functional, and that’s a responsibility we take seriously. We’ve invested heavily in state-of-the-art resources, including a modern prototype workshop, allowing you to bring your ideas to life quickly and efficiently. You’ll work alongside passionate, like-minded engineers and designers, all driven by the same goal: to make family life safer, easier, and more fun.
  
  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  

Designing and developing child bike seats and strollers that meet Thule’s uncompromising standards for safety, comfort, and usability. Driving the product development cycle from ideation to industrialization, ensuring products meet Thule’s high-quality and safety standards, while being on time and within budget. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams (designers, engineers, and project managers) to create solutions that exceed the expectations of families everywhere. Selecting the best materials and manufacturing techniques, always with a focus on durability, comfort, and sustainability. Conducting hands-on testing and prototyping to refine and perfect your designs, ensuring they deliver the best possible experience for both parents and children.
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience) with a focus on design engineering or product development. Experience with SolidWorks or similar CAD software and an understanding of materials like plastics, metals, and textiles commonly used in child safety products. A passion for designing products that solve real-world problems for families, especially in the field of children’s safety. A collaborative mindset, eager to work in a multidisciplinary team and share ideas that push the boundaries of innovation. A strong commitment to quality and safety, with a keen eye for detail in design and testing.
  
  

**About You:**  

You are passionate about creating safe, comfortable, and innovative products that will improve the lives of children and families. You are excited by the idea of being involved in the entire lifecycle of a product, from concept to market, with a focus on quality, usability, and design. You enjoy problem-solving and thrive in an environment where creative solutions are encouraged. You are motivated by the chance to leave a lasting impact on the products you design, knowing they will be part of families' everyday lives and adventures. You are proactive, self-driven, and eager to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
  
  

About our Global Product Development Department
  
Globally we are over 250 engineers out of the majority is working in our Global Product Development Center in Hillerstorp (Sweden). Our cross functional team consists of highly skilled and motivated members with a well-balanced variety of experiences. We are a truly global company with an international and multi-cultural team. English is the language we use in our daily communication. We see a great future with continued passion for product development that is so vital for our growth as a company. We set great value in our working environment and offer great premises designed for product development. In our Global R&D center in Hillerstorp we have expanded with new offices, landscapes, team rooms and creative areas, but also great prototype areas including cut & sew and electronics lab.
  
  

Application
  
The role reports to our Manager Design Engineering Strollers & CBS, Simon Stråth (simon.strath@thule.com).
  
Simon is available to answer detailed questions regarding the position by email.
  
For more information about the recruitment process or the position, please contact the recruiter Fredrik Stigbäck at Fredrik.stigback@thule.com or +46732 360560.
  
Please apply through our website at www.thulegroup.com/open-positions with your CV and cover letter.
  
Do not wait until the last application date—interviews are held continuously during the process, and the position may be filled before the final deadline of January 12th, 2025.
  
  

About Thule Group
  
  

Thule Group is a global sports and outdoor company. We offer high-quality products with smart features and a sustainable design that make it easy for people across the globe to live an active life. Under the motto Active Life, Simplified — and with a focus on consumer-driven innovation and long-term sustainability — we develop, manufacture and market products within the product categories Sport&Cargo Carriers (roof racks, roof boxes and carriers for transporting cycling, water and winter sports equipment, and rooftop tents mounted on a car), Juvenile & Pet Products (car seats, strollers, bike trailers,child bike seats and dog transport), RV Products (awnings, bike carriers and tents for RVs and caravans) and Packs, Bags & Luggage (hiking backpacks, luggage, laptop- and camera bags).
  
  

Thule Group has about 2,600 employees at nine production facilities and 35 sales offices worldwide. The Group’s products are sold in 138 markets and in 2023, sales amounted to SEK 9.1 billion.
  
  

www.thulegroup.com.

title: Design Engineer - Original Equipment to Thule Group
description:
* Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Shape the Future of Automotive Product Development!


Are you an innovative engineer eager to contribute to cutting-edge products that enhance active lifestyles? Do you have a strong interest in the automotive industry and want to work with world-leading car manufacturers to design and develop high-quality products? If you’re looking for a role that challenges your engineering skills and pushes the boundaries of automotive accessories, we want to hear from you!
  
  

At Thule, we are constantly pushing the limits of product development.
  
  

We are a world leader in providing smart, secure, and stylish solutions for people who live life to the fullest. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a talented Design Engineer to join our Original Equipment Supplier (OES) department.
  
  

**About the Role:**  

As a Design Engineer in the OES department, you will be part of a dynamic team working closely with global automotive manufacturers to develop tailored solutions for various car models. You will work on an exciting range of products including roof racks, roof boxes, bike carriers, water and winter sport solutions, and more—designed to meet specific customer requirements.
  
  

You will be responsible for developing state-of-the-art products alongside cross-functional project teams, including Project Managers, Simulation Engineers, Test Engineers, Prototype Technicians, and fellow Design Engineers. You will manage the complete product development cycle—from concept to industrialization—while ensuring that each product meets our high standards for quality, performance, cost, and design.
  
  

You will leverage your mechanical engineering knowledge and utilize tools such as CAD, simulation software, and moldflow analysis to create both functional and aesthetically appealing products. As a key player in the product development process, you will also handle prototype orders, evaluate test results, and incorporate any necessary design changes based on testing and analysis.
  
  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  

* Design and develop high-quality products and components for automotive OEMs, ensuring they meet specific requirements for functionality, cost, and timeline.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to lead the development from concept to production, while managing key product attributes like mechanical performance, manufacturability, and design compliance.
* Use CAD tools (SolidWorks preferred) and other technical tools for product design, simulation, and analysis.
* Collaborate with prototyping teams to test, validate, and refine product designs.
* Analyze test results and make design adjustments to improve strength, durability, and overall performance.
* Ensure that all designs are feasible for high-volume production, focusing on manufacturability and cost efficiency.


**What We’re Looking For:**  

* A degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent, with some years of relevant work experience in design engineering.
* Ideally, you have experience in the automotive industry or in consumer products for high-volume production.
* Experience in 3D CAD (SolidWorks preferred) and experience with PLM systems and technical documentation.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and adapt designs based on feedback from testing and simulations.
* A hands-on, proactive, and entrepreneurial mindset, with a passion for creating products that meet customer needs and exceed expectations.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment.
* Fluency in English—it’s the main language we use for communication.


**About You:**  

* You have a genuine passion for product development and a keen interest in the automotive sector.
* You thrive in a team-oriented environment and enjoy collaborating with diverse groups to solve complex engineering challenges.
* You’re self-motivated, enthusiastic, and excited to make a real impact through your work.


About our Global Product Development Department
  
Globally we are over 250 engineers out of the majority is working in our Global Product Development Center in Hillerstorp (Sweden). English is the language we use in our daily communication. We see a great future with continued passion for product development that is so vital for our growth as a company. We set great value in our working environment and offer great premises designed for product development. In our Global R&D center in Hillerstorp we have expanded with new offices, landscapes, team rooms and creative areas, but also great prototype areas including cut & sew and electronics lab..
  
  

Application
  
The role reports to our Director Design Engineering Stefan Almhill (Stefan.almhill@thule.com).
  
Stefan is able to answer detailed questions regarding the position by e-mail.
  
For more information about the recruitment process or the position, please contact the recruiter Fredrik Stigbäck, Fredrik.stigback@thule.com or +46732 360560

Thule Group is a global sports and outdoor company. We offer high-quality products with smart features and a sustainable design that make it easy for people across the globe to live an active life. Under the motto Active Life, Simplified — and with a focus on consumer-driven innovation and long-term sustainability — we develop, manufacture and market products within the product categories Sport&Cargo Carriers (roof racks, roof boxes and carriers for transporting cycling, water and winter sports equipment, and rooftop tents mounted on a car), Juvenile & Pet Products (car seats, strollers, bike trailers,child bike seats and dog transport), RV Products (awnings, bike carriers and tents for RVs and caravans) and Packs, Bags & Luggage (hiking backpacks, luggage, laptop- and camera bags).

title: Design Engineer – Sports & Cargo Solutions (Biking Focus)
description:
* Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Shape the Future of Biking and Adventure Transportation! -


Do you have a passion for designing innovative products that enhance the adventure experience? We’re looking for a talented product developer to join our team and help create safe, functional, and stylish solutions for transporting bikes and other adventure gear.
  
  

If you’re excited to apply your engineering skills to products that combine high performance, practicality, and great design, this is the opportunity for you!
  
  

At Thule Group, we’re on an exciting growth trajectory, and we’re expanding our Engineering Team to take our sports and cargo solutions to the next level. From bike racks and roof boxes to carriers for skis, kayaks, and more, we’re developing world-class products that empower active individuals to easily transport their gear—whether it’s for biking, skiing, or any other outdoor adventure.
  
  

As a Design Engineer for Bike Solutions, you’ll have the unique chance to drive innovation within the biking category, designing products that make it easier and safer for bikers to transport their bikes and accessories. From the drawing board to the final product, you’ll play a key role in designing solutions that integrate cutting-edge technology, superior functionality, and premium design—all with a focus on sustainability.
  
  

Why Thule?
  
This is more than just a job. At Thule, you’ll be joining a company that believes in the power of teamwork and creativity. We’ve invested heavily in state-of-the-art resources, including a modern prototype workshop, allowing you to move quickly from concept to hands-on prototype development. With a team of skilled engineers and designers who share your passion for biking, you’ll be part of a collaborative, dynamic environment that fosters innovation.
  
  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  

* Designing and developing new biking transportation products, including bike racks, bike carriers, and accessories, that meet Thule’s high-quality standards.
* Driving the product development cycle from ideation to industrialization, ensuring products are developed on time, within budget, and to Thule’s performance standards.
* Evaluating technical solutions, including materials selection (steel, aluminum, plastics), manufacturing processes, and aesthetic design.
* Working closely with cross-functional teams—project managers, simulation engineers, prototype makers, and more—to deliver top-tier products.
* Leveraging our state-of-the-art prototype and test facilities to refine designs through hands-on testing.


**What We’re Looking For:**  

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience) with relevant work experience in design engineering.
* Experience with SolidWorks or similar CAD software.
* Knowledge of materials like steel, aluminum, and plastics, and a deep understanding of their application in the biking industry.
* A hands-on approach to product development, with a strong preference for those who enjoy working on prototypes and testing ideas.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
* An understanding of creating clear drawings and specifications that are easy to manufacture and understand.
* Fluency in English—it’s the main language we use for communication.

* You are passionate about creating safe, comfortable, and innovative products that enhance the adventure experience.

* You thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment and enjoy sharing ideas with colleagues who share your enthusiasm for biking.

title: Senior Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
We are looking for a passionate Android developer with a proven experience in software development.
  
You will fit well if you are a social, trustful and committed person who can explain complex technical aspects verbally and in documentation.
  
You need to have ability to drive change, have a passion for innovation and new technologies. Additionally, it is expected that you have a personal drive to reach the objectives and targets set for your team.
  
Lastly, if you have a strong ability to inspire, develop and motivate individuals and teams ? you are our perfect match.
  
Requirements & Qualifications
  
Bachelor or master?s in computer science, Software Engineering, Electronics or equivalent.
  
Minimum 5 years of experience from software development and good understanding of Java/Kotlin and commonly used Android design patterns.

title: Research Engineer in Materials Science with a Focus on Thermoelectricity
description:
**Company Overview:**  

ParsNord Thermoelectric Filial is dedicated to advancing the development of cutting-edge materials and devices for thermoelectric applications. Our team works on innovative solutions that drive sustainable technology, with a focus on collaboration and excellence.
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with a strong background in Materials Science or Metallurgy Engineering to join our team. This role is primarily focused on two prestigious European projects in the fields of thermoelectricity and thermal interface materials. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work closely with highly skilled professionals and leading research groups in these fields. This position is laboratory-intensive, involving hands-on work with material synthesis and characterization. You will also contribute to various ongoing projects related to thermoelectric device manufacturing and thermal interface materials.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Synthesize thermoelectric materials.
  
Characterize thermoelectric materials and assess their properties using advanced techniques.
  
Utilize coating methods, such as sputtering, to fabricate barrier layers on thermoelectric materials.
  
Perform thermal conductivity measurements and contribute to the development of thermal interface materials.
  
Contribute to thermoelectric device assembly and characterization.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

A Master's or PhD degree in Materials Science, Metallurgy Engineering, or a related field.
  
Hands-on experience with material synthesis techniques, including powder metallurgy, ball milling, and sintering.
  
Strong knowledge of thermoelectric materials and their characterization.
  
Proficiency in CAD software such as SolidWorks and simulation tools like COMSOL Multiphysics.
  
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
  
  

**Why Join Us:**  

Work on high-impact European projects in the thermoelectricity and thermal interface materials fields.
  
Collaborate with leading research groups and highly skilled professionals in a dynamic and innovative environment.
  
Engage in hands-on, cutting-edge research that contributes to the advancement of sustainable technologies.
  
  

**Application Process:**  

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their qualifications and experience relevant to the role.

title: Software Test Specialist, QA Lead
description:
Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär som testutvecklare och samtidigt ha en nyckelroll i att leda ett mindre team och driva testutvecklingen för att säkerställa främsta kvalitet? Vi söker en erfaren Testutvecklare för inbyggda system som trivs med att ta ansvar och arbeta nära innovativa produkter. I rollen som Software Test Specialist kommer du starta i ett kunduppdrag och sedan ha möjlighet att arbeta i olika projekt, både i kunduppdrag och i våra inhouse-projekt, där du får vara med och skapa framtidens tekniklösningar.
  
  

**I ditt första kunduppdrag kommer du att:**  

Leda QA-arbetet för ett mindre team och ta helhetsansvar för testprocessen, från planering till utförande och uppföljning.
  
Driva och förbättra regressionstestning, samtidigt som du optimerar och automatiserar testprocesser för ökad effektivitet.
  
Ansvara för kravhantering och säkerställa att systemutvecklingen möter både tekniska och funktionella krav
  
Utvecklingen sker i C/C++ och Python.
  
  

Din tekniska bakgrund
  
Master-/kandidatexamen inom data, elektro eller närliggande område.
  
Testutvecklare med 5+ års arbetslivserfarenhet inom inbyggda systemspecifikt inom C/ C++, python och vana att arbeta i JIRA.
  
Goda kunskaper i att arbeta med regressionstester, kravställning och testning
  
God kommunikationsförmåga, flytande i svenska och engelska.
  
  

Dina personliga egenskaper
  
Att vara konsult kräver en flexibel och nyfiken grundinställning, ett självständigt arbetssätt och förmågan att bygga starka relationer med kunder och kollegor. Du är intresserad av de senaste teknikerna inom mjukvaruområdet och är motiverad att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.
  
Together Tech för hållbar produktutveckling
  
Vi ger möjligheter till att kunna utvecklas genom en variation av uppdrag inom olika branscher och områden, i uppdrag hos kund eller i något av våra spännande in-houseprojekt. Hos oss på Together Tech arbetar du tillsammans med andra ingenjörer som brinner för miljö och hållbarhet, alla med en vilja att skapa bestående lösningar med hjälp av teknik – eller som vi säger: Better World Tech!
  
Din utveckling & vårt stöd
  
Din utveckling och ditt välmående är viktigt för oss varpå vi erbjuder förmåner som stöttar dig och din karriär på bästa sätt. Vi värdesätter vikten av trygg anställning och fast lön, och är kollektivanslutna. För att främja din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr per år och även hälsoundersökning, bidrag till aktiviteter och friskvårdsrabatter.
  
Vi gillar att umgås med varandra i olika sociala aktiviteter, som passar alla! Alltifrån afterworks, sportaktiviteter och 5-kamp till företagskonferenser. Vi strävar efter att ge dig förutsättningar att växa genom olika uppdrag och projekt samt individuella utvecklingsplaner. Vi erbjuder även kurser inom hållbarhet och andra områden inom ramen för din roll och dina mål. Vi är stolta över att vara utsedda till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare 2024!
  
  

Vill du veta mer om oss, besök gärna vår hemsida www.togethertech.com
  
För frågor kring den aktuella tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande ledare Peter Warlich, peter.warlich@togethertech.com

title: Security Engineer
description:
You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it? The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.
  
We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.
  
Due to the universal nature of this problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, AT&T, Burberry and Heineken, get closer to their customers and make better, insights-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
  
We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
  
About the job
  
As our first dedicated Security Engineer, you'll play a key role in ensuring the security of our platform. You will join a tech team with a great team environment and high quality standards, to go from good to great when it comes to security related topics. You will nurture a robust internal security community, evolving our bug bounty program, setting security standards for our production pipeline, and defining security measures for our GenAI features.
  
  

**Your main responsibilities will include:**  

Finding and fixing code vulnerabilities
  
Testing and improving security in our AI pipelines
  
Support other engineers in secure coding practices
  
Lead and mentor our Security functional group
  
Manage our bug bounty program.
  
About you
  
To succeed in this role you will need a solid understanding of software architecture and security, including compliance and regulations. We believe you have experience from back-end development, preferably in Java/Kotlin from working in a product company. You have extensive knowledge in AWS-specific security measures, as well as OWASP or similar frameworks. Certifications such as CSSLP or OSCP is a plus, as well as experience working with Python and TypeScript. With strong communication skills and a helpful approach, you effectively collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and team members. You have the ability to prioritize and advise in all things Security, both internally at Stravito and to our customers.
  
What’s in it for you?
  
You will join a remote-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many - what’s not to like?
  
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Research Assistant
description:
Do you want to save lives? At Autoliv, we believe that no one should have to be seriously injured or lose their life in a traffic accident. Every day, we strive for this conviction by developing and manufacturing innovative products of superior quality. Because when people can feel safe while they are traveling, they can also live life to the fullest. We believe in cooperation and therefore we work closely with our customers and suppliers.
  
Being the world’s leading automotive safety supplier requires brave decisions, innovation, a focus on technology and customers – and people with a passion for saving lives.
  
We are now expanding our team within Research and are looking for a Research Assistant.
  
About the role
  
As a Research Assistant, one of your main responsibilities will be to analyze research trends. You will review proceedings to identify common themes and compare them with Autoliv’s contributions.
  
  

**You will also be responsible for:**  

Creating visual and video abstracts of papers prepared for submission.
  
Proofreading scientific articles, social media posts, and other research writing.
  
Enhancing PowerPoint presentations.
  
Producing videos of presentations (providing technical support from set-up to post-processing).
  
Writing internal news about research events (for the intranet).
  
Reviewing monthly reports and coaching writers to create appealing texts targeting the audience.
  
  

About you
  
Educational background in MBA in Marketing or similar.
  
Relevant experience is meritorious.
  
Proficiency in software tools such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and video editing tools (Adobe Premiere or similar).
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to proofread and edit scientific documents.
  
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in all tasks.
  
Ability to create engaging visual and video content.
  
  

About usResearch’s vision is to be a front runner within mobility safety research, saving more lives and increase well-being. Our mission is to generate knowledge to internal and external stakeholders, through identification and demonstration of safety needs and solutions.
  
Research focuses on safety related to two- and four-wheelers by identifying:
  
**Safety needs:** Based on real-life data, we understand safety issues and injuries related to mobility and society and develop tools to recreate and assess road user behavior and injuries.
  
**Safety solutions:** We identify opportunities for products and services and demonstrate the effectiveness of new technologies and solutions.
  
**Safety markets:** We anticipate and open up market opportunities.
  
  

Our offer
  
Autoliv is a place where people grow, develop and become their best selves. We do not leave our personalities at the door, but bring them in to help shape a dynamic, versatile, and stimulating organization.
  
We face enormous challenges and a dynamic, rapidly changing market. To meet these challenges, we will need the very best from the very best. By meeting these challenges, we strive for excellence as an organization, but also for each individual. We help each other grow and perform to the top of our abilities and achieve beyond what we thought was possible.
  
We believe in your awesomeness! Let's be awesome together!
  
Practical information
  
**Place of Work:** Vårgårda
  
**Scope:** Part-time
  
**Employment type:** Fixed, around 5 months
  
**Start date:** According to agreement
  
Questions
  
Questions about the position is answered by Christian-Nils Boda, Senior Research Engineer, christian-nils.boda@autoliv.com.
  
Collective agreement
  
We have collective agreement with Sveriges Ingenjörer/Unionen/Ledarna and IF Metall. Union representatives can be reach via the company switchboard, + 46 322 62 62 00.
  
Application
  
Welcome with your application no later than 202x-xx-xx in the form of a CV and personal letter. As part of the recruitment process, candidates who go further will need to prove their CV with a copy of diploma, certificate / grade.

Ogden UT, United States 84401

title: Field Service Engineer Remote Nordic, EMEA
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Strong Odors (chemical, lubricants, biological products etc.), Will work with hazardous/toxic materials**Job Description**


Job Title: **Engineer III, Field Service, Nordic & EMEA**


Being part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, doing bold work, and joining a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $35 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.

**Location/Division Specific Information**


Location: Field Nordic, Remote / Field EMEA Remote

**Division: Laboratory Automation**

**Discover Impactful Work**


The main focus of the role is repair, maintenance and installation of Cytomat Products, Laboratory Automation (LAI) products and selected 3rd party equipment at customer sites in Demark and across Europe. A second strong priority is passionate about customer relations’ activities intended to generate sales Customer Support Services and Service Contracts to customers in this engineer’s area.

**A day in the Life:**

* Schedule and Perform on-site maintenance, repair and installation on all Cytomat Products and other LAI system components and instrumentation.
* Perform on-site training relative to system service, maintenance, and basic operation.
* Keep track and maintain your local spare part's inventory
* Ensure that all documentation related to in-house and on-site support activity is completed accurately and submitted on a timely basis. This includes maintenance of electronic files, Field Service Reports, Service Work Orders and Quotes.
* Diagnose problems over the phone and/or using remote software. Where vital, follow up with on-site work or dispatch third-party service providers for on-site work. Follow up to ensure problems were resolved to the customer’s happiness.
* Actively supervise the status of contract, warranty and time and material installed customers.

**Keys to Success**

**Education**


Technology diploma in Mechatronics, Electro-mechanical engineering, Electrical or Mechanical engineering, or equivalent.

**Experience**

* Minimum 5 years practical experience in field service or solving software and lab equipment
* Validated experience with automation, robots, and/or device instrumentation.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities**

* System-level diagnostic skills using inquiries, observations, system schematics & documentation, software tools, and communications / electrical diagnostic aids
* Multi-disciplinary technical skills / excellent with software, electrical, and mechanical systems
* Computers, serial communications, and software - comfortable with general use of computers, adept with serial communications cabling, Network diagnostics, and have at least a rudimentary knowledge of programming languages to be able to read a program and understand the logic.
* Wiring and pneumatics (schematics, PLCs, power panels)
* Mechanical systems (CAD drawings, fasteners)
* Working proficiency of Momentum software features and operations is a plus.
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, must have a professional working proficiency in English, additional languages helpful.


You will receive a competitive salary, company car, company pension scheme and will have outstanding development and career prospects in a globally growing company. Apply today!


Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We are also an equal opportunities organization.


Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Senior QA engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.


We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. Doesn't matter if you are in the beginning or in the peak of your career - we invite you to apply! The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.


What We Offer:

* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


As a senior QA engineer at Umain, your role will involve:

  

* Having extensive experience with manual testing and writing/maintaining automation testing frameworks for both mobile & web.
* Setting standards for manual and automation testing across all our projects and tech stacks.
* Driving automation engineering as a skill within Umain.
* Be responsible for testing test stack decisions and be part of early project planning to ensure the best possible testing strategy for the particular client.
* Collaborating closely with developers to ensure test driven development is a core part of their development process.
* knowing how to decide, in a consulting environment, what the level of QA involvement should be based on the clients needs & requirements.


Who You Are:

* You're a QA engineer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


Why Umain?

* Career Framework:
We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance:
At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning:
Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees:
We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**


If you're a QA engineer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Role:**
* Build and implement a dynamic style guide using JavaScript (Vanilla + ES5), CSS, and HTML5.
* Integrate the style guide with an existing MVC Razor platform, ensuring a modular and sustainable solution.
* Implement accessibility-first approaches following WCAG/A11Y standards.
* Write testable, maintainable, and robust code with a focus on quality.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders and communicate across multiple roles.
* Prioritize SEO best practices and maintain a strong understanding of Git for version control.
* Work within an agile development environment, contributing to a highly collaborative team.


****Essential requirements:****
* 10+ years of hands-on experience in web development, with proficiency in JavaScript, CSS, and HTML5.
* Deep understanding of WCAG/A11Y and experience designing accessible and inclusive solutions.
* Competence with Git for version control, SEO best practices, and MUI.
* Familiarity with React for building dynamic user interfaces.
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to drive projects forward with multiple stakeholders.
* Agile mindset with a strong focus on delivery.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.


**Meritorious:**
* Experience with Next.js, .NET, Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift would be a plus.


**Last day to apply** 
 : 06-12-2024
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Fullstack Developer – B2B Portal & Digital Health Services** 




 We’re looking for a skilled and curious Fullstack Developer to join our Product & Tech team at Bond Health Group, a dynamic collective of digital health services, including Bruce Studios and STC. Your main focus will be on building and improving our new exciting initiative - our new B2B portal.
 



  





**What you will do:** 



* **Development:** 
 Continue building and maintain features that make the B2B portal user-friendly, reliable, and scalable for our users.
* **Collaborate across teams:** 
 Work closely with designers, product owners, and other developers to create seamless solutions.
* **Innovate and Improve:** 
 Take ownership of your work, suggest improvements, and help shape the technical direction of the portal.
* **Fullstack Fun:** 
 From backend services to frontend interfaces, you’ll be working across the stack to deliver complete solutions.
* **Contribute to other products:** 
 Jump into other Bond Group services like Bruce Studios and STC, lending your expertise wherever it’s needed.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* Minimum 3 years of experience as a Fullstack Developer or in a similar role.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proficiency in frontend technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, or Angular).
* Strong experience with backend technologies (e.g., Node.js, Go, or Python) and frameworks.
* Good understanding of SQL databases, preferably Postgres, and experience with REST APIs.
* Experience with Svelte in frontend is a plus.
* An eye for usability and a strong interest in building great user experiences.
* A collaborative mindset – you’re a team player who communicates well and enjoys working with diverse stakeholders.
* Bonus: Experience with B2B platforms or interest in digital health services.



  





**Why Join Us:** 



* The opportunity to shape two critical digital products at the core of our strategy.
* A dynamic, collaborative environment where your contributions make a real impact.
* A chance to blend creativity, analytics, and leadership to solve exciting challenges.
* Flexible working hours and the freedom to shape your way of working.
* 30 days vacation and pension benefits.
* A fun, unpretentious, and relaxed team with cooperation across national borders.
* A Bruce Studios membership.



  





 If you’re passionate about building great products that meet both business and user needs, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**How To Apply:** 




 Send your application in Swedish or English, and tell us why you think this job is right for you, at the latest by January 15th.
 



 Starting date: Asap, but for the right candidate we are willing to wait.
 



 As diversity is something that is important to us we’d love to see applicants from all gender identities, ages, cultural backgrounds and physical abilities.
 



  





**About us:** 




 Bond Health Group are proud to be a part of Novax, the investment arm of Axel Johnson, one of Sweden’s leading family-owned business groups. This strong backing empowers us to focus on innovation and long-term growth, with a clear commitment to building transformative digital health solutions.
 



 Bond's mission is simple: we are dedicated to develop solutions, products, and companies that accelerate human health and wellbeing. By doing so, we aim to contribute to building a happier, healthier society.
 



  





 Currently, Bond Health Group is home to two key companies:
 


* **Bruce Studios:** 
 Offers access to over 800 studios and gyms across Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Copenhagen, Oslo, and Bergen. Bruce Studios gives members access to a diverse range of workouts, from CrossFit and yoga to climbing, all through a digital membership in the Bruce app.
* **STC:** 
 One of Sweden’s most prominent wellness companies, operating over 250 gyms nationwide. STC’s mission is to inspire people of all ages to stay active with affordable, high-quality training options designed to make fitness accessible to everyone.



  





 Join us at Bond Group and be part of a company committed to creating meaningful impact in the world of health and wellness.

title: Full Stack and AI Developer Intern
Software Developer, Nordea Node
description:
**Job ID: 27610** 






  
 





 Are you a person motivated by delivering business value through software automation? Nordea Node is now looking to recruit a new backend software developer as part of Nordea Life & Pensions Sweden’s continued push in digitalizing the insurance market. Nordea Node currently works with some of Sweden’s leading employers, including tech, IT-consultants and law firms.
 





  
 





 This role is based in Malmo, Stockholm, Sweden. This is a permanent, full-time, Hybrid, position.
 

  
 





 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
 





  

  



**About our team** 






  
 





 Nordea Nodes mission is to help employers and their employees towards a better and safer life. We offer you an exciting workplace with the opportunity to work on a modern technology stack (microservices, GraphQL, Node.js, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform) developing the premier benefit brokerage platform in Sweden. Our tech and product team consist of around 20 highly motivated colleagues. At Nordea Node you get to work in a dynamic start-up-like environment, whilst having access to the great benefit package offered by Nordea Group and Nordea Life & Pensions Sweden.
 

  
 





 As a backend developer at Nordea Node you will be part of an agile team responsible for writing and maintaining several services in our microservice architecture.
 





  
 



**The responsibilities include:**



* Developing new features in close collaboration with other teams, product managers, business users and other stakeholders.
* Instrument applications for observability, debugging and continuous improvement.
* Work with our infrastructure team to implement best practices in terms of security and availability.
* Continuously monitor the performance of the team’s services to fulfill SLOs and resolve issues.



  
 





**Who you are** 






  

  



 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 





 As a backend developer at Nordea Node you have a great interest in the business, facilitating a great understanding of the business logic necessary to deliver concrete business value for our users.
 





  
 



**We are looking for a person with:**



* Formal education in computer science and/or software development
* Experience with Kubernetes and microservice architectures
* Experience with DevOps and continuous delivery



  
 





**Nice to have:** 





* Experience writing Node.js microservices
* Experience writing GraphQL apis
* Experience from the insurance industry



  
 





**What we offer** 






  
 





 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 





  
 





**A culture**
**that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 





  
 





**Hybrid working model**

 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
 





  
 





**Diversity and inclusion**
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 





  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 



**Next Steps**




  
 





 Submit your application no later than 30/12/2024. For more information, you are welcome to contact Theodor Lindquist (theodor.lindquist@nordeanode.se) for this opportunity related queries and Ritu Mittal (ritu.mittal@consult.nordea.com) for HR related matters.
 





  
 





**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 


  
 





**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 





  
 





**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
 





  
 





**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 





  
 





**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
 





  
 





 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
 





  
 





 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at
 
 finansforbundet@nordea.se
 
 or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: Software Engineer, Java
description:
****The role****
 Join Our Team at Kindred - Are you the software engineer we are looking for?
   

  

 Are you passionate about innovation and working in an ever-changing, competitive industry? Our Payment team is seeking a dedicated individual with expertise in Java and Spring, React JS is a plus, to enhance the payment experience for customers across all brands. If you thrive in dynamic environments, aspire to leave a lasting impact, and seek to work with cutting edge technologies, ApplePay and next generation card payments, this is your opportunity to shine!
   

  

 You will participate in design discussions with your colleagues to find great solutions to complex engineering challenges. We strongly believe in the “You Design it, You Build It, You Test It, You Run It, You Tweak It” ethos and everyone is expected to take part of the full system / development life cycle to ensure reliability and uptime of the production environment.
   

  

****Your experience****
* Proficiency in building services in Java and Spring framework
* Knowledge of build pipeline preferably Jenkins CI/CD
* Basic understanding of React JS, Javascript and/or Typescript. Having worked with micro-frontends is a plus
* Good understanding of Git, Gradle, Maven, RPM and Docker
* Experience working in agile environments
* Continuous Delivery
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment


**In addition, you..**
 Are a positive person by nature and have a passion for what you do, putting teamwork and collaboration above all else?
   

  

 Have great communication skills and appreciate a culture where feedback sharing is encouraged to achieve not only to the success of the team, but also seen as essential to the improvement of personal and professional development.
   

  

 Take great pride in your ability to grasp complex business scenarios and translate them into solutions with high quality, clean and performant code.
   

  

 Believe in yourself and your own abilities, but also appreciate that there is an endless ocean of new things to learn and take on board, cherishing the opportunity to do so.

title: Summer Internship 2025 Stockholm R&D
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**Summer internship: R&D in Tech**
 Step into a world of innovation and creativity with Ericsson, a leading tech company behind the mobile revolution and over 60,000 patents. Our summer internship isn’t just a steppingstone to experience; it’s a chance to explore your potential and contribute to cutting-edge technologies, opening the doors for a meaningful career in tech.
   

  

 At Ericsson, you’re not just an intern; you’re a vital part of our team. We encourage you to learn, lead, and make an impact, allowing you to shape not just your own career but perhaps the future of technology too.
   

  

**Shape the future of technology.**
* Work on exciting projects—be part of a program that saw around 450 students contribute to impactful initiatives in 2024. Your specific project will be determined during the recruitment process.
* Get access to our cutting-edge toolkit - it's like a tech treasure chest! You’ll gain hands-on experience in areas such as AI, machine learning, test development, hardware development, embedded software, and more.
* Take part in a journey where co-creation and teamwork are key to everything we do.
* You won’t be alone, you will connect with fellow interns and our technical experts through engaging activities, building a supportive community.
* Get mentorship and guidance to help you grow both personally and professionally.


**Bring your knowledge into real-world solutions.**
 We believe that you're studying fields such as Engineering Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology (IT), Electrical Engineering, or related fields. If you’re a programmer, math whiz, hardware lover, or simply someone who is genuinely excited about technology, there’s a place for you at Ericsson!
   

  

**Application Details**
 This is an ongoing recruitment process, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Applications will be reviewed continuously, with the final closing date on January 26th. Please submit your cover letter and CV together in one file. You are welcome to submit your application in English.
   

  

 For additional questions, reach out to us at student.sweden@ericsson.com.
   

  

**Keywords** 
 : sommarpraktik, sommarjobb, praktikplats, 5G/6G, IoT, cybersäkerhet, automation, hållbarhet, forskning, maskininlärning, molntjänster, telekommunikation, robotik, SaaS, mjukvaruutveckling, mångfald och inkludering, agil, programmering, digital innovation, sustainability, embedded systems, robotics, cybersecurity.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

 If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com
   

  

 DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

 Sweden (SE) || [[location\_obj]]
